Description: One pendant and 12 beads made in different shapes and materials. A: Small pendant in the shape of a grape bunch with one lug at the top (broken off) and one lug at the bottom. The rear is flat and the upper side is textured. Made of pale blue turquoise faience. B: Five segmented cylindrical beads made of white faience. C: Four disc-shaped beads, one of them broken in half, two made of white faience and two of ostrich eggshell. D: One flattened spherical bead made of faience but with a pearlescent corroded glaze (glass?). E: Two extended spherical beads made of white faience.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E13.2, AA[e, below III floor]
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
